page.title: 03BIRD LIFE INLAND & COASTAL
page.content: {Oystercatchers}are frequent autumn and summer visitors on the beaches. {Shags}and{Cormorants}abound.{Rooks}in large numbers colonize{Langdon Woods and Church Wood.{Buzzards}hover over the higher ground.{Chaffinches}can be seen along the footpath leading down to{Bovisand Bay}from{Staddiscombe. These birds have also been seen :- {Kestrel,Pied Wagtail,Green Woodpecker, {White Throat,Wren,Sandwich Tern, {Greenfinch,Magpie,Cuckoo,Swallow, {Stonechat,House Martin,Yellowhammer, {Heron,Long Tailed Tit.}When we went from{Bovisand Bay}to{Heybrook Bay}we saw a{Heron}standing in the sea. At the Shag Stone we saw many{Shags}and {Cormorants}nesting and flying close to the surface. There are lots of noisy {Wood Pigeons}and{Rooks}in Church Wood Estate.{Rooks}sit on wires watching. A{Hoopoe}was seen on April 28th 1985.
